author: Staff Reporter
text:
Pudhu Vaazhvu Thittam employees have appealed to the State government to make them permanent government employees as they have been working under this project for the past one decade.

This appeal was made at a State-level meeting of Pudhu Vaazhvu Thittam employees held here on Sunday.

Talking to media persons after the meeting, Tamil Nadu Government Employees Association State vice-president P. Krishnasamy said that 1,500 persons had been working under this project for 10 years. Earlier, they had worked under Vaazhndhu Kaatuvom Scheme.
title: Regularise job: staff
